org.tair.sql.expression
Interface IScalarExpression<T>

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the value resulting from evaluation of the expression in SQL
All Superinterfaces:
IExpression
All Known Subinterfaces:
ISelectExpression<T>
All Known Implementing Classes:
BigDecimalExpression, BigDecimalSubqueryExpression, BigIntegerExpression, BigIntegerSubqueryExpression, BooleanExpression, BooleanSubqueryExpression, IntegerExpression, IntegerSubqueryExpression, ScalarSubqueryExpression, StringExpression, StringSubqueryExpression, TimestampExpression, TimestampSubqueryExpression
public interface IScalarExpression<T>
extends IExpression

A scalar expression results in a value of type T on execution of the SQL statement. Most expressions are scalar expressions. The scalar expression interface lets you resolve a ResultSet into a value for the expression.

Author:
Robert J. Muller

Method Summary
 T getValue(java.sql.ResultSet rs)
          Get the expression value from the result set based on the alias or on the expression string itself if the alias is null or nonexistent.

getExpression, getLexicalVariables, getSql, getVariable, setVariable
 

Method Detail

getValue

T getValue(java.sql.ResultSet rs)
           throws java.sql.SQLException
Get the expression value from the result set based on the alias or on the expression string itself if the alias is null or nonexistent. The concrete implementation of the template implements the proper JDBC call for the type T. You must call the next() method on the result set before passing it to this method.

Parameters:
rs - the JDBC result set from which to extract the value using the alias if it is not null or the expression if the alias is null; the result-set pointer must be positioned to a valid row using the next() method before calling this method
Returns:
the value of type T from the result set
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - when there is a problem getting the value from the result set using the expression or its alias
